[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [Resource: Memory usage] [Iterator memory exhaustion] Can large-scale prefix queries that match millions of StateKeys cause the indexer to allocate excessive memory for result sets, triggering OOM kills? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [Resource: Batch size] [Batch size limits] Does the indexer enforce maximum batch sizes for StateKeysSchema writes, or can single transactions with huge write sets cause unbounded batch growth? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [Cross-schema: Transaction indexing] [Atomic indexing failure] If OrderedTransactionByAccountSchema writes succeed but StateKeysSchema writes fail within the same batch, can this create inconsistency where transactions are indexed but their state changes aren't? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [Cross-schema: Event indexing] [Version metadata skew] Can mismatches between EventVersion and StateVersion metadata cause queries to see events but miss corresponding state key changes, breaking application consistency assumptions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [Cross-schema: Metadata ordering] [Metadata update timing] Does the indexer update LatestVersion metadata before or after committing StateKeysSchema entries, and can this ordering cause queries to see incomplete index states? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [API: get_prefixed_state_value_iterator] [Pagination bypass] Can attackers craft StateKeyPrefix values that bypass pagination limits in the API layer, causing excessive database reads from StateKeysSchema? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [API: ensure_cover_ledger_version] [Stale index queries] If API queries occur before indexer has caught up to latest ledger version, can StateKeysSchema return incomplete results without proper error indication? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [Config: enable_statekeys flag] [Runtime toggle race] Can dynamically enabling/disabling the enable_statekeys config flag mid-operation cause StateKeysSchema to have gaps where some versions are indexed and others aren't? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [Config: batch_size] [Batch size manipulation] Can attackers exploit extremely large batch_size configurations to cause StateKeysSchema to process massive batches that trigger timeout or memory issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [Error: Decode failures] [Graceful degradation] When decode_key() fails on corrupted indexer DB data, does the system gracefully degrade or does it crash preventing all state key queries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [Error: Encode failures] [Silent encoding errors] If encode_key() encounters an error during batch preparation but continues processing, can this lead to silent loss of some state keys in the index? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [Error: Schema writes] [Partial batch commits] When db.write_schemas(batch) fails for StateKeysSchema, does the RocksDB transaction properly rollback all changes or can partial writes persist? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [Type: StateKey variants] [Variant confusion] Can type confusion between StateKey::AccessPath, StateKey::TableItem, and StateKey::Raw variants during encoding/decoding lead to incorrect indexing or security bypasses? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [Type: BCS encoding] [BCS version compatibility] If BCS serialization format changes between Aptos versions, can old StateKeysSchema entries become undecodable, causing indexer failures during upgrades? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [Type: Arc<Entry> deduplication] [Registry poisoning] Can attackers exploit the StateKey registry deduplication mechanism to cause hash collisions that make distinct state keys share the same Arc<Entry>, corrupting the index? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [DB: Column family isolation] [CF contamination] Can operations on other column families inadvertently corrupt STATE_KEYS_CF_NAME data due to incorrect column family handle usage? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [DB: RocksDB compaction] [Compaction data loss] Can RocksDB compaction processes cause StateKeysSchema entries to be incorrectly removed or corrupted if the schema's tombstone handling is misconfigured? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [DB: Snapshot restoration] [Checkpoint inconsistency] During indexer DB restoration from checkpoints, can StateKeysSchema end up with entries from mixed versions, causing query inconsistencies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [Test: proptest] [Fuzzing insufficient coverage] Does the proptest in test.rs adequately cover malicious StateKey inputs with boundary conditions, or are there edge cases in encode/decode that aren't tested? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/state_keys/mod.rs] [Test: test_no_panic_decoding] [Panic safety gaps] Are there specific byte sequences that can cause panics in decode_key() despite the test_no_panic_decoding macro, such as integer overflows in BCS deserialization? (Medium)
